subject: ACCC will not oppose Wesfarmers (WES AT) proposed acquisition of Catch Group
PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN, JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: Earnings including Honda, Isuzu, Kyocera and Yahoo Japan
content:
AUSTRALIA

Bellevue Gold (BGL AT) - Co. reports new high-grade gold discovery beneath the Bellevue Gold mine. (Newswires)

Flight Centre Limited (FLT AT) - Co. acquired North American premium leisure and corporate travel business Les Voyages Laurier du Vallon. (Newswires)

Monadelphous Group (MND AT) - Co. received new construction and maintenance work valued at around AUD 150mln. (Newswires)

News Corp (NWS AT) - Fox Corp (FOXA) will acquire Credible Labs (CRD AT) for AUD 2.21/Shr. (Newswires)

Other News - US Secretary of State Pompeo urges Australia to boost joint efforts to address security challenges posed by China. (Newswires)

 

JAPAN

Fast Retailing (9983 JT) - Co. July same store sales fell 10.3% Y/Y. (Newswires)

Honda (7267 JT) - Co. Q1 net JPY 172.3bln vs. Prev. JPY 244.3bln Y/Y, rev. JPY 4.00tln vs. Prev. JPY 4.02tln Y/Y, Co. lowers FY net and global vehicle sales guidance but affirms oper. profit and revenue. (Newswires)

Isuzu Motors (7202 JT) - Co. Q1 net JPY 27.4bln vs. Prev. JPY 38.1bln Y/Y, rev. JPY 509.1bln vs. Prev. JPY 488.1bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Kobe Steel (5406 JT) - Co. Q1 net loss JPY 1.16bln vs. Prev. profit JPY 12.7bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Kyocera (6971 JT) - Co. Q1 net JPY 32.0bln vs. Prev. JPY 42.3bln Y/Y, Co. confirms it has shifted production from China to Vietnam. (Newswires)

Mitsui Fudosan (8801 JT) - Co. Q1 net JPY 33.2bln vs. Prev. JPY 38.1bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Nissan (7201 JT) - Renault (RNO FP) is reportedly in discussions with the Japanese automaker on reducing its 43% stake in an effort to ease tensions between the alliance partners. (Newswires)

Olympus (7733 JT) - Co. Q1 net JPY 8.6bln vs. Prev. loss JPY 16.7bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Resona Holdings (8303 JT) - Co. is to invest additional JPY 10bln in its Singapore unit. (Newswires)

Yahoo Japan (4689 JT) - Co. Q1 net JPY 27.4bln vs. Prev. JPY 32.7bln Y/Y, rev. JPY 238.6bln vs. Prev. JPY 231.9bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Other News - Japan issued travel advice for citizens travelling to South Korea and has asked them exercise caution as well as stay away from protest sites. (Newswires)

 

SOUTH KOREA

Kumho Petrochemical (011780 KS) - Co. Q1 net KRW 115bln vs. Exp. KRW 110bln. (Newswires)

Trade South Korea is seeking stable supply of 100 parts and materials, while South Korean PM Lee said the government will sincerely implement counter measures on Japan’s economic restrictions. (Newswires) Other News - South Korea was said to approve KRW 5.83tln extra budget to support the economy, while it was also reported that South Korea will set aside KRW 1.0tln in next year’s budget to deal with Japan’s trade restrictions. (Newswires/Yonhap)

subject: Kiwibank sees RBNZ lowering OCR to 0.75% in 2020
HSBC (5 HK) H1 adj. pre-tax profit USD 12.5bln vs. Prev. USD 11.7bln Y/Y, Adj. rev. USD 29.4bln vs. Prev. USD 27.3bln Y/Y; announces to buyback up to USD 1.0bln of shares
Hong Kong authorities expect flight cancellations and other transport disruptions as 500k protesters plan a city-wide strike
Hong Kong authorities expect flight cancellations and other transport disruptions as 500k protesters plan a city-wide strike
HSBC (5 HK) CEO Flint steps down and Noel Quinn is named interim CEO
New Zealand Shadow Board does not expect a change in RNZ's OCR this week but says easing bias is still apprpriate
analysis_details: • As a reminder, market consensus is for a 25bps cut to 1.25% at Wednesday's meeting.

subject: ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include Australia PMIs and Melbourne Institute Inflation Expectations, Chinese Caixin Services and Composite PMIs
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA-PAC

US President Trump said US has to have a better deal, not an even deal with China and that China has a lot to do to turn things around, while he also stated that he can always raise tariffs and China's currency is "going to hell". (Newswires/Twitter)

There were initial reports that US President Trump is willing to shelve China tariffs if China takes positive action, according to CNBC's Tausche citing a senior admin official. However, NEC Director Kudlow later stated he has not heard anything definitive about a possibility of China tariff delays and that US President Trump is not satisfied with progress in talks. Furthermore, Kudlow stated that a number of good things could happen in the month prior to tariffs going on Chinese goods and that good things could arise from the September meeting between US and China. (Newswires/CNBC/Fox)

China said on Friday it would not “give an inch” by offering trade concessions to the United States and promised to retaliate if US President Trump went ahead with imposing further tariffs. (SCMP)

China’s US Ambassador said if the US wants to talk about trade, then so will China, and if the US want to fight, so will China, while he added that new tariffs are an irrational and irresponsible act which Beijing will take new adequate countermeasures against. The Ambassador also commented on Hong Kong protests which he said are turning out to be violent as well as chaotic and should no longer be allowed to continue. (Newswires)

China's Global Times Editor said the Chinese side always has a second plan B including a series of counter measures and that Beijing is very disappointed by the latest "flip-flops of the US", while he quoted a well-informed official as saying "China won't fight the battle unprepared”. (Twitter)

PBoC will comprehensively use multiple monetary policy tools in H2 and maintain prudent monetary policy, while it will strengthen counter cyclical adjustments and lower RRR at an appropriate time. PBoC will also continue interest rate and exchange rate reform, as well as keep liquidity reasonably ample. (Newswires)

Protests continued in Hong Kong again in which police fired tear gas into protesters. There were comments from the Hong Kong government that illegal protests are pushing the city to extremely dangerous edge, while China stated it will not allow the situation to persist. (Newswires)

 

UK/EU

UK PM Johnson pledged GBP 1.8bln to upgrade 20 hospitals as part of meeting his Brexit pledges. In related news, PM Johnson’s most senior aide Dominic Cummings told ministers and officials Johnson will honour his October 31st pledge even if Jeremy Corbyn and pro-Remain Conservatives succeed in forcing a general election. (Newswires/Telegraph)

US President Trump confirmed he will sign a beef agreement with EU which will make it easier for US firms to export to the EU and result in a 46% increase in US exports of beef to the EU. In other news, US President Trump said EU auto tariffs are never off the table and that if he doesn't get what he wants, he'll have no choice but to put on auto tariffs. (Newswires)

Fitch affirmed Greece at 'BB-'; Outlook Stable. (Newswires)

  • UK Markit/CIPS Construction PMI (Jul) 45.3 vs. Exp. 46 (Prev. 43.1). (Newswires)
  • EU Retail Sales MM Jun 1.1% vs. Exp. 0.2% (Prev. -0.3%, Rev. -0.6%)
  • EU Retail Sales YY Jun 2.6% vs. Exp. 1.3% (Prev. 1.3%, Rev. 1.0%)
  • EU Producer Prices YY Jun 0.7% vs. Exp. 0.8% (Prev. 1.6%)

 

COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes Oil rigs -6 at 770, nat gas rigs +2 at 171, total rigs -4 at 942. (Newswires) 

 

GEOPOLITICS

Satellite imagery reportedly showed minimal activity around North Korea's Yongbyon nuclear complex with some evidence of probable continued operations of the Uranium Enrichment Plant, while there were also reports that North Korea said it has never agreed on limiting missile distance. (Newswires)

Iran reportedly seized an Iraq oil tanker that was allegedly smuggling fuel in the Gulf, although the Iraq Oil Minister denied any links to the tanker. (Newswires)

Turkey plans to carry out an operation east of the Euphrates in Syria, while US and Russia have been notified. (Newswires)

 

US

US President Trump is to address the nation on Monday following a mass shooting incident in El Paso, Texas in which 20 were killed, while there was also a mass shooting in Dayton, Ohio in which 9 were killed and President Trump suggested that more gun control may be needed. (Newswires)

Fed's George (Voter, hawk) explained her dissent at Wednesday's FOMC in which she stated the moderation in the economy was in line with her outlook at the start of the year, while she added there are risks to her outlook and will be data dependent in shaping her outlook. (Newswires)

Fed’s Rosengren (Voter, Hawk) commented on his dissent at the FOMC in which he stated he does not see a clear and compelling case for additional monetary accommodation at this point. (Newswires)

NEC Director Kudlow said the Trump Administration has ruled out any currency intervention is not concerned about the market reaction to the latest China tariffs. (Newswires)

  • US Non-Farm Payrolls Jul 164k vs. Exp. 164.0k (Prev. 224.0k, Rev. 193k). (Newswires)
  • US Unemployment Rate Jul 3.7% vs. Exp. 3.7% (Prev. 3.7%)
  • US Average Earnings YY Jul 3.2% vs. Exp. 3.1% (Prev. 3.1%)
  • US Factory Orders MM Jun 0.6% vs. Exp. 0.8% (Prev. -0.7%, Rev. -1.3%)

 

MARKET RECAP

Risk off trade saw the stock slide continue, as the predictably negative Chinese response to Trump’s most recent tariff announcement kept trade tensions at the forefront. Higher beta and China exposed sectors were the underperformers; Chipmakers Cisco Systems (CSCO) and Skyworks Solutions (SWKS) lead the Nasdaq 100 lower. The FANG index sunk, with analysts at Bank of America noting that Trump’s new tariffs would put a dent in Apple’s (AAPL) earnings. Defensive sector outperformance saw the utility, consumer staple and health care sectors comparatively well supported. Decent earnings from Exxon Mobil (XOM) and Chevron (CVX) were unable to turn the tide, the energy sector sunk with lower crude prices (compared to the beginning of the week), and recent poor earnings from the likes of Concho Resources (CXO), Marathon Petroleum (MPC) and Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD) dragging on the sector. Boeing (BA) was well supported on the news that the co. is redesigning its 737 MAX so that it is dependent on both of the plane’s flight-control systems instead of just one. Cloudera (CLDR) shot higher on the news that activist investor Carl Ichan had taken a 12.6% stake in the co., and said he would speak with the board and management about enhancing shareholder value. IBM (IBM) spiked higher on the news that the co. is targeting single digit growth in FY20/21. S&P 500 -0.7% at 2932, Nasdaq-100 -1.4% at 7692, Dow Jones -0.4% at 26487.

The yield curve flattened, taking its cue from escalating trade escalations, shrugging-off a generally upbeat payrolls report. Markets have now fully priced a September rate cut, and have 100bps of easing priced through the end of 2020 (note, in wake of the payrolls report, it was roughly 70bps priced, which suggests that traders have added to their easing expectations in wake of the trade escalation. At settlement, major curve spreads were narrower. US T-note (U9) futures settled 5+ ticks higher at 128-27+.

subject: Japanese Economy Minister Motegi says US and Japan has made significant headway towards a bilateral trade agreement and have bridged much of the rift, while the sides will conduct another meeting by month-end
ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
